title: Evaluation of Lattice Spacing of Precipitates and Matrix in a Ni-Al-Ti Alloy by NBD and Image Analysis using Two Condenser-Lens TEM
content: Nano-beam electron diffraction (NBD) is a useful technique for studying crystallographic structures at the nanometer scale. Our group reported a simple method to measure d-spacing by finding the center of diffraction disks without using high-end TEMs [1-3]. In these papers, we succeeded in distinguishing SiGe and Si whose {111} d-spacing differences were about 0.004 nm, and it was shown that the convergence angle did not affect the final results. Recently, we applied this technique for Ni-Al-Ti alloy and tried to distinguish the 0.002 nm d-spacing change between γ matrix and γ’ precipitates, but we did not accomplish this purpose yet [4, 5]. In this paper, we investigated the best experimental condition based on our TEM and the best analysis method for the Ni-Al-Ti specimens to achieve 0.002 nm resolution by NBD.
